    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        protected Hero(float width,
    float height,
    java.lang.String imgName)
        Construct a Hero by creating a PhysicsSprite and incrementing the number of heroes created. This code should never be called directly by the game designer.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the hero
        height - The height of the hero
        imgName - The name of the file that has the default image for this hero

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(SpriteBatch sb,
          float delta)
        We can't just use the basic PhysicsSprite renderer, because we might need to adjust a one-off animation (invincibility or throw) first
        Overrides:
        render in class PhysicsSprite
        Parameters:
        sb - The SpriteBatch to use for drawing this hero
        delta - The time since the last render

      • makeAsBox

        public static Hero makeAsBox(float x,
             float y,
             float width,
             float height,
             java.lang.String imgName)
        Make a Hero with an underlying rectangular shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the hero
        y - Y coordinate of the hero
        width - width of the hero
        height - height of the hero
        imgName - File name of the default image to display
        Returns:
        The hero that was created

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int amount)
        Give the hero more strength than the default, so it can survive more collisions with enemies. Note that calling this will not run any strength change callbacks... they only run in conjunction with collisions with goodies or enemies.
        Parameters:
        amount - The new strength of the hero

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        Return the hero's strength, in case it is useful to trigger code
        Returns:
        The strength of the hero

                 float y)
        Indicate that upon a touch, this hero should begin moving with a specific velocity
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension

      • setJumpImpulses

        public void setJumpImpulses(float x,
                   float y)
        Specify the X and Y velocity to give to the hero whenever it is instructed to jump
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X direction
        y - Velocity in Y direction
